Context: The Academic Upgrading (A751) program is a free program offered by the college, funded by the Employment Ontario branch of the Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development (MLITSD). It helps students upgrade their skills in communications, math, and science to prepare for college-level post-secondary programs, apprenticeship, or employment. Students have access to academic advising and career counselling, and may be eligible for a transportation allowance. The program delivery is flexible with both full-time and part-time options available, running year-round with classes starting every seven weeks. Students create an individualized learning plan based on their life, academic, and career goals, and the length of the program varies based on initial assessment, specific goals, and individual progress. Prior to starting the program, a reading and writing assessment is required to determine literacy levels and program eligibility. The college offers several Academic Upgrading program streams in Communications, Math, and Science, including Foundations, ACE (Academic and Career Entrance), Pre-ACE, ACE Business Math, ACE Apprenticeship Math, ACE Technology Math, physics, chemistry, and biology. Completing courses in this program can earn students Academic and Career Entrance (ACE) designation.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Academic Upgrading Program A751 | George Brown College2024.txt

Program Information:
- Name: Academic Upgrading program
- Courses offered:
  - BIOL 7104: ACE Biology
  - CHEM 7104: ACE Chemistry
  - PHY 7104: ACE Physics
  - COMP 7101: ACE Foundations Computers
  - COMP 7041: ACE Intermediate Computer Studies
  - ENGL 7028: Foundations Communications
  - ENGL 7030: Pre-ACE Communications
  - ENGL 7076: Communications Grammar Support
  - ENGL 7101: ACE Communications
  - MATH 7101: ACE Math for Technology
  - MATH 7102: ACE Math for Apprenticeship
  - MATH 7103: ACE Math for Business
  - PREP 7160: Orientation
  - PREP 7138: ACE Personal and Professional Exploration
- Program Learning Outcomes: Students are expected to demonstrate specific knowledge and skills by the end of their program.
- No fees for domestic students as it's funded by Employment Ontario through MLTSD.
- Not eligible for OSAP funding.
- Admission Requirements:
  - Resident of Ontario
  - Admission assessment
  - Fluency in English
  - Mature student status (19 years of age or older)
- Application:
  - Intakes every seven weeks
  - Information sessions held biweekly. Everyone is welcome to attend a session.

Context:
The text provides information about various programs and services offered by George Brown College for academic upgrading. Here are the key facts extracted from the text:

1. To apply for the Academic Upgrading Program, learners need to complete an application form and attend a reading and writing assessment. Appointments for assessments can be made during information sessions. Assessment sessions are held weekly throughout the year as space permits.
2. Contact information for the Academic Upgrading program: phone number 416-415-5000, ext. 3560 and email address upgradinginfo@georgebrown.ca.
3. George Brown College offers a free week-long CHOICES class for exploring different options for post-secondary programs and careers. The class is offered at St. James Campus. For more information, visit the CHOICES page or email choices@georgebrown.ca.
4. Interested individuals can take a free three-week Mature Student Assessment Preparation class if they plan to write the Mature Student Assessment. Register online or email msap@georgebrown.ca.
5. George Brown College offers tuition-free Degree Bridging (U-level) courses for individuals who are thinking of applying to a degree program but are missing a prerequisite course. These courses are offered throughout the year in English, math, sciences and biology and are accepted by George Brown College and Curriculum Services Canada as U-level equivalent courses for entrance to George Brown degree programs (currently not accepted for entrance to Ryerson BScN program and course credits are not transferrable to universities or other institutions). Register for U-Level here.
6. ACE level classes in math, sciences, computers and communications are available online through the ACE Distance Program.
7. George Brown College offers Academic Upgrading for Deaf and hard-of-hearing adults. For more information, visit Deaf Learn.
8. If you are a Deaf or hard-of-hearing adult and would like to study online, you can join Deaf Learn.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Academic Upgrading Program A751 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
If you are interested in studying online as an adult with hearing difficulties, you can check out Deaf Learn Now at George Brown College. They offer Academic Upgrading program areas including Choices, Mature Student Assessment Preparation and Degree Bridging classes.

Related programs available include Practical Nursing (S121), Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Certificates and Diplomas (A109), and Dental Hygiene (S134).

You can visit the campus, book a campus tour or info session, and sign up to receive tailored resources for application. The form requires your first name, last name, email address, and domestic or international status along with your country. You must have JavaScript enabled to use the form and agree to receive email communications from George Brown College.
